location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: ‘Sketch map reduced from Sir R.M. Stephenson’s Railway map of Europe and Asia in 1850 and of China in 1863 Shewing the Proposed Railway Communication Connecting Europe and Asia. By Sir Rowland Macdonald Stephenson. 1882’

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:630 x 1147 mm; on sheet 676 x 1220 mmFoliation:The map sheet has been foliated in the front top right hand corner of the folio with a pencil number enclosed in a circle.

mods.abstract: Imprint:London, Connell Litho. 37 Castle St. Holborn E.C.Distinctive Features:Outline map showing the completed and proposed railway scheme in Europe and Asia, with lines coloured for reference and explained in a key provided in the lower centre of sheet.Below title the note: London, Brussels, Paris, Berlin Vienna and Constantinople with Teheran, Herat, Kandahar, Sukkur, Lahore, Bombay, Madras and Calcutta and eventually with Burmah and China.
